register.description: MODULE REVISION This register contains the IP revision code in binary coded digital. For example, we have: 0x01 = revision 0.1 and 0x21 = revision 2.1

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
IP revision [7:4] Major revision[3:0] Minor revision

register.description: SYSTEM CONFIGURATION REGISTER This register is the OCP-socket system configuration register.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Sets the behavior of the master port power management signals.

bitenum.description: Force-standby. Hardware signal is only asserted when the module is disabled.
No-standby. Hardware signal is never asserted.
Smart-standby: Hardware signal is asserted based on the activity of the module. The module tries to go to standby during the vertical blanking period.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Software reset. Set the bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. The bit is automatically reset by the HW. During reads return 0.
Internal OCP gating strategy

bitenum.description: Automatic OCP clock gating strategy is applied based on the OCP interface activity.

register.description: SYSTEM STATUS REGISTER This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status register.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
Internal reset monitoring

bitenum.description: Internal module reset is on going.

register.description: INTERRUPT STATUS REGISTER - All contexts This register associates one bit for each context to determine which context has generated the interrupt. The context must be enabled for events to be generated on that context. If the context is disabled, the interrupt is not generated.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
OCP Error Interrupt

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Short packet reception status (other than sync events: Line Start, Line End, Frame Start, and Frame End: data type between 0x8 and x0F only must be considered).

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: ECC has been used to do the correction of the only 1-bit error status (short packet only).

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: ECC error status (short and long packets). No correction of the header because of more than 1-bit error.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Error signaling from Complex I/O #1: status of the PHY errors received from the complex I/O #1 (events are defined inCSI2_COMPLEXIO1_IRQSTATUS for the 1st complex I/O).
FIFO overflow error status.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Context 7
Context 6
Context 5
Context 4
Context 3
Context 2
Context 1
Context 0

bitenum.description: Event generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: ECC has been used to correct the only 1-bit error (short packet only).

bitenum.description: Event generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: ECC error (short and long packets). No correction of the header because of more than 1-bit error.

bitenum.description: Event generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: Error signaling from Complex I/O #1: the interrupt is triggered when any error is received from the complex I/O #1 (events are defined inCSI2_COMPLEXIO1_IRQSTATUS for the 1st complex I/O).

bitenum.description: Event generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitenum.description: Event generates an interrupt when it occurs

register.description: GLOBAL CONTROL REGISTER This register controls the CSI2 RECEIVER module. This register must not be modified dynamically (except IF_EN bit field).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
VP clock enable.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
VP only enable.

bitenum.description: The VP is enabled and the OCP master port is enabled.
The VP is enabled and the OCP master port is disabled.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Video port output clock control. Sets the video port output clock as a function of the interface clock (OCPCLK).

bitenum.description: No division: video port clock = OCPCLK.
Division by 2: video port clock = OCPCLK/2.
Division by 3: video port clock = OCPCLK/3.
Division by 4: video port clock = OCPCLK/4.

bitfield.description: Enables the debug mode.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Set the modality in which IF_EN works.

bitenum.description: If IF_EN = 0 the interface is disabled immediately.
If IF_EN = 1 the interface is disabled after all FEC sync code have been received for the active contexts.

bitfield.description: Enables the Error Correction Code check for the received header (short and long packets for all virtual channel ids).
Enables the physical interface to the module.

bitenum.description: The interface is disabled. If FRAME = 0, it is disabled immediately. If FRAME = 1, it is disabled when each context has received the FEC sync code.

The interface is enabled immediately, the data acquisition starts on the next FSC sync code. Writing 1 to this register when the current value is 0 has the effect to clear the output FIFO. The pixel data of the following frame are written in the PING buffer, that is, the.PING_PONG bits are reset to 0 as well.

register.description: DEBUG REGISTER (Header) This register provides a way to debug the CSI2 RECEIVER module with no image sensor connected to the module. The debug mode is enabled by.DBG_EN. Only full 32-bit values must be written. The register is used to write short packets and header of long packets.

bitfield.description: 32-bit input value.

register.description: GENERIC PARAMETER REGISTER This register provide a way to read the generic parameters used in the design.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Output FIFO size in multiple of 68 bits.
Number of contexts supported by the module.

register.description: COMPLEXIO CONFIGURATION REGISTER for the complex I/O #1 This register contains the lane configuration for the order and position of the lanes (clock and data) and the polarity order for the control of the PHY differential signals in addition to the control bit for the power FSM.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Internal reset monitoring of the power domain using the PPI byte clock from the complex io

bitenum.description: Internal module reset is on going.

bitfield.description: Command for power control of the complex io

bitenum.description: Command to change to OFF state
Command to change to ON state
Command to change to Ultra Low Power state

bitfield.description: Status of the power control of the complex io

bitenum.description: Complex I/O in ultra-low power state

bitfield.description: Automatic switch between ULP and ON states based on ULPM signals from complex I/O
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads returns 0.
+/- differential pin order of DATA lane 2.
Position and order of the DATA lane 2.

bitenum.description: Data lane 2 is at the position 1.
Data lane 2 is at the position 2.
Data lane 2 is at the position 3.

bitfield.description: +/- differential pin order of DATA lane 1.
Position and order of the DATA lane 1. The data lane 1 is always present.

bitenum.description: Data lane 1 is at the position 1.
Data lane 1 is at the position 2.
Data lane 1 is at the position 3.

bitfield.description: +/- differential pin order of CLOCK lane.
Position and order of the CLOCK lane. The clock lane is always present.

bitenum.description: Clock lane is at the position 1.
Clock lane is at the position 2.
Clock lane is at the position 3.

register.description: DEBUG REGISTER (Payload) This register provides a way to debug the CSI2 RECEIVER module with no image sensor connected to the module. The debug mode is enabled by.DBG_EN. The register is used to write payload of long packets.

bitfield.description: 32-bit input value.

register.description: TIMING REGISTER This register controls the CSI2 RECEIVER module. This register must not be modified while.IF_EN is set to 1. It is used to indicate the number of L3 cycles for the Stop State monitoring.

bitfield.description: Control of ForceRxMode signal

bitenum.description: De-assertion of ForceRxMode. The HW reset the bit at the end of the Force RX Mode assertion. The SW can reset the bit to stop the assertion of the ForceRXMode signal prior to the completion of the period.

bitfield.description: Multiplication factor for the number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE_COUNTER_IO1 bit-field

bitenum.description: The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER_IO1 is multiplied by 1x
The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER_IO1 is multiplied by 16x

bitfield.description: Multiplication factor for the number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE_COUNTER_IO1 bit-field

bitenum.description: The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER_IO1 is multiplied by 1x
The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER_IO1 is multiplied by 4x

bitfield.description: Stop State counter for monitoring. It indicates the number of L3 cycles to monitor for Stop State before de-asserting ForceRxMode (Complex I/O #1).The value is from 0 to 8191.

register.description: CONTROL REGISTER - Context This register controls the Context. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Number of FEC to receive between using swap ofCSI2_CTx_DAT_PING_ADDR and CSI2_CTx_DAT_PONG_ADDR for the calculation of the address in memory. (must be used only in interlace mode, otherwise set to 1)

Sets the number of frame to acquire. Once the frame acquisition starts, the COUNT value is decremented after every frame. When COUNT reaches 0, the FRAME_NUMBER_IRQ interrupt is triggered and CTX_EN is set to 0. Writes to this bit field are controlled by the COUNT_UNLOCK bit. During the same OCP write access , the bit-field COUNT_UNLOCK must be written in addition to COUNT bit-field to change the COUNT value. COUNT can be overwritten dynamically with a new count value.' 0: Infinite number of frames (no count).1: 1 frame to acquire...255: 255 frames to acquire.
Indicates if the end of frame signal must be asserted at the end of the frame.

bitenum.description: The end of frame signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.
The end of frame signal is asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Indicates if the end of line signal must be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: The end of line signal is not asserted at the end of each line.
The end of line signal is asserted at the end of each line.

bitfield.description: Enables the checksum check for the received payload (long packet only).
Unlock writes to the COUNT bit field.

bitenum.description: COUNT bit field is locked. Writes have no effect
COUNT bit field is unlocked. Writes are possible.

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the PING or PONG destination address (CSI2_CTx_DAT_PING_ADDR or CSI2_CTx_DAT_PONG_ADDR) was used to write the last frame. This bit field toggles after every FEC sync code received for the current context.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Line modulo configuration

bitenum.description: .LINE_NUMBER is used once per frame for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ.
.LINE_NUMBER is used as a modulo number for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ (multiple times the interrupt can be generated for each frame)

bitfield.description: Enables the Context

bitenum.description: COUNT bit field is locked. Writes have no effect
COUNT bit field is unlocked. Writes are possible.

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the PING or PONG destination address (CSI2_CTx_DAT_PING_ADDR or CSI2_CTx_DAT_PONG_ADDR) was used to write the last frame. This bit field toggles after every FEC sync code received for the current context.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Line modulo configuration

bitenum.description: .LINE_NUMBER is used once per frame for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ.
.LINE_NUMBER is used as a modulo number for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ (multiple times the interrupt can be generated for each frame)

bitfield.description: Enables the Context

register.description: CONTROL REGISTER - Context This register controls the Context. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Number of FEC to receive between using swap ofCSI2_CTx_DAT_PING_ADDR and CSI2_CTx_DAT_PONG_ADDR for the calculation of the address in memory. (must be used only in interlace mode, otherwise set to 1)

Sets the number of frame to acquire. Once the frame acquisition starts, the COUNT value is decremented after every frame. When COUNT reaches 0, the FRAME_NUMBER_IRQ interrupt is triggered and CTX_EN is set to 0. Writes to this bit field are controlled by the COUNT_UNLOCK bit. During the same OCP write access , the bit-field COUNT_UNLOCK must be written in addition to COUNT bit-field to change the COUNT value. COUNT can be overwritten dynamically with a new count value.' 0: Infinite number of frames (no count).1: 1 frame to acquire...255: 255 frames to acquire.
Indicates if the end of frame signal must be asserted at the end of the frame.

bitenum.description: The end of frame signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.
The end of frame signal is asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Indicates if the end of line signal must be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: The end of line signal is not asserted at the end of each line.
The end of line signal is asserted at the end of each line.

register.description: DATA MEM ADDRESS OFFSET REGISTER - Context This register sets the offset, which is applied on the destination address after each line is written to memory. This register applies for both and . For example, it enables to perform 2D data transfers of the pixel data into a frame buffer. In such case, the pixel data and frame buffer data must have the same data format. Note that the 5 LSBs are ignored: the offset must be a multiple of 32 bytes. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code. Only full 32-bit values must be written.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.

Line offset programmed in bytes (signed value 2's complement). If OFST = 0, the data is written contiguously in memory. Otherwise, OFST sets the destination offset between the first pixel of the previous line and the first pixel of the current line.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.

register.description: DATA MEM PING ADDRESS REGISTER - Context This register sets the 32-bit memory address where the pixel data are stored. The destination is double buffered: this register sets the PING address. Double buffering is enabled when the addresses and are different. Note that the 5 LSBs are ignored: the address should be aligned on a 32-byte boundary. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code. Only full 32-bit values must be written.

bitfield.description: 27 most significant bits of the 32-bit address.
5 least significant bits of the 32-bit address. Write 0s for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
